description.summary: set compositor-side backdrop color for surfaces

protocol.description:
This protocol provides a way for clients to request a compositor-rendered backdrop color behind their surface content. The backdrop is drawn by the compositor between the wallpaper/background and the window content, allowing compositor-managed elements (such as voice orb animations) to be layered between the backdrop and the window.
The backdrop color respects the surface's corner radius if set via the corner radius protocol.

interface.name: backdrop_color_manager_v1
interface.description: Manager for creating backdrop-color objects for surfaces. Works with any wl_surface.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will no longer use this global. Any previously created backdrop-color objects remain valid until destroyed.

request.name: get_backdrop_color

description.summary: Create a new backdrop-color object for a surface

request.description:
Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_surface to specify a compositor-side backdrop color.
If the given wl_surface already has a backdrop_color_surface_v1 object associated, the backdrop_color_exists protocol error will be raised.

entry.name: backdrop_color_exists
entry.summary: the surface already has a backdrop-color object

interface.name: backdrop_color_surface_v1
interface.description:
The backdrop-color object provides a way to specify a compositor-rendered background color for its associated surface.
If the wl_surface associated with the backdrop_color_surface_v1 object has been destroyed, this object becomes inert. Any further requests other than destroy will raise the surface_destroyed protocol error.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will no longer be using this protocol object. The backdrop color will be unset on the next commit.

request.name: set_color
request.description:
This request sets the backdrop color for the surface. The color is specified as RGBA components, each in the range 0 to 255.
The backdrop color is double-buffered state and will be applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

request.name: unset_color
request.description: Unsets any previously set backdrop color without invalidating the object for later use.

entry.name: surface_destroyed
entry.summary: the associated surface object has been already destroyed
